text:
In a short time, Members of Congress will mark the passage of the workers and families-focused, bipartisan #CARESAct. #FamiliesFirst

Tune in here: https://www.facebook.com/NancyPelosi/

Massachusetts schools quickly stepped up to feed hungry kids during this crisis, but many districts don’t qualify for @USDA reimbursement. With more and more families in need, USDA should use its authority to fully reimburse schools' free meal programs. https://www.warren.senate.gov/oversight/letters/mass-lawmakers-urge-usda-to-fully-reimburse-school-districts-and-after-school-programs-providing-free-meals-to-kids-during-covid-19-pandemic

It's no surprise to anyone that the current occupant of the White House would make such a statement. But rest assured that *we will* provide accountability and oversight. 

That's the difference between them and us: we are worker-focused while they prioritize corporations. https://twitter.com/kyledcheney/status/1243664170496688129 http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1243714190893813760/pu/img/Np-AxAfflUYxNcPV.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1243714190893813760/pu/vid/480x270/RvFqeF22CV3lQufy.mp4?tag=10 QT @kyledcheney JUST IN: Trump signing statement on coronavirus bill says he’ll override a provision requiring the newly created inspector general to report to Congress  any time agencies refuse to give him/her requested info. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUJh99cXkAIlBJw.jpg

🚨@realDonaldTrump just signed the CARES Act – another crucial step in combatting #COVID19 and addressing the damage this virus has caused – into law.
 
To all those hurting right now in #TX and across the country: relief is on the way. https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1243637430483390470 QT @realDonaldTrump I just signed the CARES Act, the single biggest economic relief package in American History – twice as large as any relief bill ever enacted. At $2.2 Trillion Dollars, this bill will deliver urgently-needed relief for our nation’s families, workers, and businesses. #CARESAct🇺🇸 https://twitter.com/senategop/status/1243613618186465280
RT @BostonGlobe Massachusetts will join the federal government in extending its income tax filing deadline from April 15 to July 15, officials said Friday. http://w.bos.gl/NbsjciI

Our country is facing a severe blood shortage due to COVID-19. Now more than ever, the @US_FDA must end its discriminatory blood donation ban for gay & bisexual men. @SenatorBaldwin & I are once again urging the FDA to shift from its antiquated policy to one based on science. https://twitter.com/SenatorBaldwin/status/1243295948446535681 QT @SenatorBaldwin COVID-19 has created a blood shortage and we must increase our nation’s supply based on science & facts. @US_FDA should not prevent healthy gay & bisexual men from helping to solve our shortage. FDA should change discriminatory blood donation policies to help save lives. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUESryFXYAMMoGm.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUESryGXkAETlPK.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUESryKX0AEx8EO.jpg

In this crisis we must listen to the experts and do everything we can to protect our medical personnel who are on the front lines. Join our livestream with doctors and nurses on the frontlines of the coronavirus pandemic: https://www.pscp.tv/w/cU0r3TMyNzU3OTl8MU1ueG5RclpyVnlKTyrFZ_Y0ZFifBWvW6Qky8wAJX072EUCPJEsCkkBe7Hww

Trump has the power to use the Defense Production Act to order the production of more masks and ventilators.

He says, “we don’t need it.”

Tell that to the nurses and doctors reusing masks.
Tell that to the patient who needs a ventilator but can't get one.

We need it.

The Senate passed historic legislation this week but Congress’ job is nowhere close to being finished. We have so much more to do to provide assistance to families and small businesses, expand paid leave, protect homeowners and renters, and more.

This is good news for our healthcare heroes and first responders working to #CombatCOVID19 & for the millions of people in #TX and across the country in need of immediate relief.
 
I look forward to @realDonaldTrump signing this emergency relief package into law without delay. https://twitter.com/AP/status/1243591306091397128 QT @AP House OKs $2.2 trillion rescue package for virus-ravaged U.S. economy and health system, rushing it to President Trump for his signature. Follow @AP's complete coverage of the pandemic. https://apnews.com/VirusOutbreak?utm_medium=AP&utm_source=Twitter&utm_campaign=SocialFlow

Right now, the phone lines of unemployment offices around the country are jammed and websites are crashing. The federal government must immediately put together the necessary staffing and technology to address the unprecedented number of requests for help that are coming in.

The House just passed the coronavirus bill, giving some relief to hospitals, small businesses & struggling Americans. But it’s not enough. I won’t stop fighting until we get paid sick & family leave, extended food assistance & further help for those hardest hit by this crisis.

RT @60PlusAssoc Just after the Senate voted unanimously to approve the largest stimulus package in the history of the country Wednesday, Sen. Ted Cruz joined The Daily Wire’s Michael Knowles to break down the bill and what it means for the American people. https://www.dailywire.com/news/watch-ted-cruz-explains-how-2-trillion-relief-bill-got-passed-and-what-it-means-for-americans

My mom works an hourly job.

This is personal to me. https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1243549110180941824 QT @thehill Rep. @AOC: "What did the Senate majority fight for? One of the largest corporate bailouts with as few strings as possible in American history. Shameful!" http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUH5T_fX0AAP8i5.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1243548821621215234/vid/462x270/RznUtWAEvjRDhAvb.mp4?tag=13
Losing your job and being unemployed is difficult enough. You shouldn’t lose your health insurance too. Medicare for All means always being covered.

RT @JStein_WaPo NEW: Congress will soon make Steven Mnuchin one of the most powerful cabinet secretaries in modern history

Mnuchin crafted $2T bill that gives him enormous authority -- even amid suspicions from GOP Senators & Trump himself

W/ @jdawsey1 @costareports 

https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/03/27/trump-mnuchin-coronavirus-treasury/

RT @kylegriffin1 Pelosi to @maddow on this: "Of course, it's not a surprise to anyone. But Congress will exercise its oversight and we will have our panel ... The president's statement is indicative of the difference between Democrats and Republicans when it came to this bill." https://twitter.com/kylegriffin1/status/1243703118967083008 QT @kylegriffin1 Big flag via Politico: Trump intends to ignore provisions in the newly passed $2 trillion coronavirus relief bill intended to shore up Congress' oversight of the massive rescue program.
https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/27/trump-congress-coronavirus-relief-oversight-152560

Right now, phone lines of unemployment offices around the country are jammed and websites are crashing.

The stimulus package just passed can provide real help to millions, but it won't matter unless the federal bureaucracy is able to implement the program and get the money out.

RT @RepRoKhanna After 5 years of war, and 80% reliant on humanitarian aid for basic survival, Yemenis may be the planet’s most vulnerable people in the face of COVID-19. 

This ceasefire proves an end to the war is possible. 

Yemen needs peace, food, medicine, and diplomacy—not more US bombs. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUFAHmjXkAU_RKM.jpg

Unconscionable. We’re in the middle of a public health crisis and the Trump administration is giving companies the power to pollute our air and water just so they can save a couple bucks.
https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1243298455264649218 QT @thehill EPA suspends enforcement of environmental laws amid coronavirus https://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/489753-epa-suspends-enforcement-of-environmental-laws-amid-coronavirus http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUEVWx9WoAE5R3B.jpg

RT @cspan .@RepAOC @AOC: "Our community's reality is this country's future if we don't do anything. Hospital workers do not have protective equipment. We don't have the necessary ventilators. We have to go into this vote eyes wide open..." http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUH4MB4WoAMD-Hl.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1243547416067964930/vid/480x270/RFxDBCJn53deN7V0.mp4?tag=13

RT @michaeljknowles If Tom Lehrer weren't still alive, I might be convinced to believe in reincarnation. https://twitter.com/petershankman/status/1243611688659750914 QT @petershankman When the #quarantine is over, I want to buy this man dinner. Who is he? This might be the best thing I've seen in weeks. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1243611554408476672/pu/img/BDDREw1_50RXl0Wd.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1243611554408476672/pu/vid/582x270/I_ibk2Hw8L5Qufm0.mp4?tag=10

This is a crisis.

The stimulus package just passed can provide real help to millions, but it won’t matter unless the federal bureaucracy is able to implement the program and get the money out.

No business as usual. People need help NOW, not in several months.

Earlier today, I spoke with the Acting Secretary of the @USNavy in part to extend my deep gratitude to the crew of USNS Mercy for supporting California during this crisis. They are heroes. https://twitter.com/USNavy/status/1243596754550915074 QT @USNavy Answering the call, it's what we do. 

#USNSMercy Arrives in Los Angeles in #COVID19 response - https://www.navy.mil/submit/display.asp?story_id=112490&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_content=100001204595675&utm_campaign=Man http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUIkpklWsAYC7k5.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1243596564951707648/pu/vid/480x270/k7h3H-x4ysx74fvz.mp4?tag=10

To the millions of Americans hurting as a result of the coronavirus pandemic: relief is on the way. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1243538323685203971/img/NUI2PoKuCpyliFTg.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1243538323685203971/vid/480x270/EnnyrVE5deMMt4Sx.mp4?tag=13

RT @justinamash Congress and President Trump put taxpayers on the hook for billions of dollars to United Airlines in exchange for keeping their work force intact at least through September 30.

Immediately after the bill was signed, United announced upcoming layoffs—to begin after September 30. https://twitter.com/cnbcnow/status/1243624566125182977 QT @CNBCnow JUST IN: United Airlines warns aid isn’t enough to avoid workforce cuts https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/27/corovanirus-fallout-united-airlines-warns-aid-isnt-enough-to-avoid-workforce-cuts.html?__source=twitter%7Cmain

RT @RioTazewell Thank you @SpeakerPelosi for taking the disastrous multi trillion dollar corporate handout drafted by #MoscowMitch and the Senate and getting critical oversight and other provisions added to help workers, families and healthcare professionals in this time of crisis #COVID2019 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUKLY5-XgAAG4_H.jpg

RT @TeamWarren Our tech team worked hard to make getting involved with @ewarren's campaign as easy as possible. We leaned heavily on open source technology , and we want to contribute back. So we're open-sourcing some of our most important projects for anyone to use. https://medium.com/@teamwarren/open-source-tools-from-the-warren-for-president-tech-team-f1f27d2c7551

RT @Yamiche .@AOC notes that 13 ppl died in Elmhurst Hospital in NY last night before ripping into $2 trillion bill. "What did the senate majority fight for? One of the largest corporate bailouts...in American history. Shameful. The greed of that fight is wrong, for crumbs for our families!”

Too often, our fellow Americans in Puerto Rico and U.S. territories are overlooked in times of crisis. We can’t let that happen in the middle of a pandemic.

If you live in these areas, know that I see you and I’m fighting for you.

Americans who don’t have health insurance shouldn't have to worry that seeking care for #COVID19 will lead to a mountain of bills & possible bankruptcy. The President should reopen the marketplace so Americans can enroll in the coverage they need. https://www.booker.senate.gov/?p=press_release&id=1101

RT @thehill Speaker Nancy Pelosi: "They transformed a Republican corporate-focused bill into a Democratic workers-first focus." http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1243609715470471168/img/DJjume-wuZdhxDj_.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1243609715470471168/vid/428x270/Twhn7qkE4iEgHj-J.mp4?tag=13

Once passed by the House, the CARES Act will provide relief for the people that are hurting. It will:
✔️Send checks to individuals/families ($1,200 per adult & $500 per child)
✔️Provide $377B in emergency relief for small biz, which will help keep employees on the payroll http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1243538323685203971/img/NUI2PoKuCpyliFTg.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1243538323685203971/vid/480x270/EnnyrVE5deMMt4Sx.mp4?tag=13

Hey @LisaAnnWalter, I'm answering your question!

And I want you to know that I'm fighting every day to make sure this support gets to gig workers as soon as possible. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUJd2UvXQAE2uZP.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1243659004632608768/vid/320x320/avDyfaZmA50JLilc.mp4?tag=13

Without coronavirus tests, our health care workers are fighting coronavirus blind & our communities are stuck in limbo. The only way we’ll know how to control this epidemic is with rigorous testing. That’s why I outlined ways to ramp up testing fast. https://medium.com/@SenWarren/congress-must-move-to-rapidly-increase-our-coronavirus-testing-capacity-8c5abd71b6f1?source=friends_link&sk=ae0e98f34e0606274c49634461df01dc https://twitter.com/BuzzFeedNews/status/1242610919374336001 QT @BuzzFeedNews Doctors and nurses who've been exposed to the coronavirus should not be tested if they don’t have symptoms, a NYC health department memo says https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/laurenwolfe/nyc-tells-doctors-told-not-to-have-a-coronavirus-test?bftwnews&utm_term=4ldqpgc#4ldqpgc

RT @kgyp Speaking now on the House floor: @AOC opens saying 13 people died in Queens overnight of the #coronavirus and criticized the Phase Three bill: "The option we have is to either let them suffer or let this greed leveraged into billions of dollars increasing income inequality gap."

There are 700K DACA recipients whose uncertainty about the future has multiplied because of this pandemic.

Ending DACA during this unprecedented crisis would be disastrous and cruel. I support a request filed at the Supreme Court today urging them not to issue a ruling now.

The right decision & one I’ve urged repeatedly. The Defense Production Act has its origins in leg that helped us marshal the incredible strength of the American free enterprise system to win WWII. We can’t follow Italy; we must build more ventilators NOW to save lives tomorrow. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUJHvtRXsAMPkQ1.jpg

RT @UNITEDWEDREAM #SCOTUS must delay their decision on #DACA during the #COVID19 pandemic.

Aldo, a paramedic, DACA recipient, & UWD Florida member says it loud and clear: "It’s imperative that the Supreme Court take account of conditions that did not exist back in Nov."
https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/27/us/dreamers-tell-supreme-court-ending-daca-during-pandemic-would-be-catastrophic.html

Cruz on @FoxNews ahead of House vote on emergency relief: This going to pass. It is going to pass overwhelmingly, which means relief is on the way.

In the Senate, we passed it unanimously. Every single Senator voted yes. @SenSanders voted yes, so did I, and everybody in between. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1243530397532774402/img/EyUYa0wY_ys0Il5J.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1243530397532774402/vid/480x270/24VUwPUOuG0_wtzv.mp4?tag=13

Never forget: The current occupant of the White House lied to us. He said everything was great. He said he had this under "control." Yet here we are. Over 1,500 deaths now. 

We need to be there #ForThePeople; we need to put #FamiliesFirst during this unprecedented crisis https://twitter.com/TeamPelosi/status/1243201346024681472 http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1243731512232677376/pu/img/2QHEBA9NKWtgJiFM.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1243731512232677376/pu/vid/480x270/W-7a2gOC6DgAhZ2F.mp4?tag=10 QT @TeamPelosi Nearly 1,000 deaths in the United States. It's a tragedy. 

That's why Democrats are taking bold action: testing, testing, testing; masks, masks, masks; addressing the emergency health needs while putting our workers and #FamiliesFirst. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1243197842971398144/pu/img/_DHfeTYeLqbsd66N.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1243197842971398144/pu/vid/480x270/JlaH747GjP9FnEaF.mp4?tag=10

Health experts tell us this pandemic is going to get worse before it gets better—which is why we need to continue practicing social distancing & #flattenthecurve. It’s dangerous to say we're going back to business as usual by Easter. We have work to do. https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/25/politics/donald-trump-coronavirus/index.html

It is a stain on our nation's soul that we keep sending our health care workers onto the front lines without the protective equipment they need. We need to invoke the Defense Production Act immediately to dramatically ramp up the manufacturing of medical supplies. https://twitter.com/nypost/status/1242912698318422017 QT @nypost Worker at NYC hospital where nurses wear trash bags as protection dies from coronavirus https://nypost.com/2020/03/25/worker-at-nyc-hospital-where-nurses-wear-trash-bags-as-protection-dies-from-coronavirus/?utm_medium=SocialFlow&utm_campaign=SocialFlow&utm_source=NYPTwitter http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ET-2gwUWoAk6Cta.jpg

And just like that, the Congressional oversight provisions for the 1/2 TRILLION dollar Wall St slush fund (which were *already* too weak) are tossed away the day the bill is signed.

This is a frightening amount of public money to have given a corrupt admin w/ 0 accountability. https://twitter.com/kyledcheney/status/1243664170496688129 QT @kyledcheney JUST IN: Trump signing statement on coronavirus bill says he’ll override a provision requiring the newly created inspector general to report to Congress  any time agencies refuse to give him/her requested info. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUJh99cXkAIlBJw.jpg

Fully agree. Let’s cut everyone some slack & come together as Americans. https://twitter.com/realjameswoods/status/1243224308635160576 QT @RealJamesWoods You’ll be stunned to hear me say this, but @kathygriffin just lost her mother. Let’s take the high road and cut her some slack. Be kind.

The House’s passage of the bipartisan #CARESAct sends a clear message: we are all committed to protecting America’s workers and families as our nation confronts this public health crisis. #FamiliesFirst http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUIx7r4XQAkMfbf.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUIx_qRWsAQkZ6N.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUIyBIcWsAAQSG9.jpg

DACA recipients are working hard to support their families and communities, and to ensure they and their loved ones are safe and healthy. Thousands of them are health care workers on the front lines of this pandemic. I stand with them in this fight. #HomeIsHere https://twitter.com/MaketheRoadNY/status/1243569220690067456 QT @MaketheRoadNY BREAKING: We have filed a letter to the Supreme Court in our #DACA litigation w/ @NILC @WiracYLS asking the Justice not to rule without considering the real-world consequences of the #COVID19 pandemic. /1

Full letter here: https://maketheroadny.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/2020-03-27-FINAL-Letter-to-Court.pdf http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUIInV-WAAAdgCr.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUIIoSRXkAAbf29.jpg

Members of Congress are coming together following the passage of the bipartisan #CARESAct, a families & workers-first relief package. With my signature, this legislation heads to the President’s desk. #FamiliesFirst https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1BdxYQgWzZAxX

Tonight I will be hosting a livestream with doctors and nurses on the frontlines of the coronavirus pandemic. Tune in at 7 p.m. ET at http://live.berniesanders.com. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUJfD3WWAAIgXZO.jpg

Beautiful reminder from NJ's Morristown Medical Center that we owe a debt of #gratitude to everyone on the frontlines of this crisis—from our public health workers to our nurses & doctors to hospital staff & so many others—you are true heroes. Thank you. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUH3F6wXYAIRLNU.jpg
RT @GarrettHaake “Our community’s reality is this country’s future if we don’t do something,” @AOC on the floor, talking about NYC & Elmhurst hospital.

If Trump won’t use the DPA, Congress needs to step in & force his administration to act. Congress just gave them $1 billion more to get industry up & running – now it must make the President use it for more tests, more PPE, & more supplies to protect the American people.

Let's get this straight:
❌Wells Fargo scammed customers & blamed low-wage workers.
❌It used the #GOPTaxScam for stock buybacks & laid off workers.
❌Now it’s endangering workers during a global pandemic.
You really still have no shame, huh @WellsFargo?
https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/4ag8qj/im-terrified-wells-fargo-demands-call-center-employees-come-into-work

SCOTUS suspended arguments because they know the threat coronavirus poses. They must take this crisis into consideration on a DACA decision too.

This could upend the lives of 700,000 young people, including many on the front lines who are working as health care practitioners.

RT @Ilhan Amazon is putting the lives of workers at risk by exposing them to COVID-19.
 
That's why I led a letter with @SenSanders demanding a response plan to protect Amazon workers during this pandemic. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUIX7CKXsAUYnLp.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUIX7CIX0AAzm_n.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUIX7CLXgAIKzmC.jpg

In the midst of a pandemic and an economic crisis, the Trump administration just made it easier for predatory payday lenders to exploit struggling families. This is an appalling, dangerous move that will trap more families in a punishing cycle of debt. https://twitter.com/NCLC4consumers/status/1243249401688186880 QT @NCLC4consumers Under the cover of the #COVID19 crisis, @CFPB, @FDICgov, @USOCC, @federalreserve, & @TheNCUA issued small dollar bank lending guidance that lacks the consumer protections needed to ensure loans do not trap borrowers in a cycle of debt. #StopTheDebtTrap 1/3 https://www.nclc.org/media-center/civil-rights-and-consumer-groups-condemn-emergency-regulatory-guidance-that-allows-banks-to-make-payday-loans.html

This is absolutely barbaric. The cruelty and absurdity of our for-profit health care system is more obvious in the midst of this crisis than it has ever been. We need Medicare for All. https://gizmodo.com/teen-who-died-of-covid-19-was-denied-treatment-because-1842520539

RT @wgbhnews BREAKING: Gov. Baker: "Starting today, all travelers arriving to the commmonwealth are instructed to self-quarantine for 14 days." https://www.wgbh.org/news/local-news/2020/03/27/watch-live-governor-baker-gives-update-on-coronavirus

The House has passed the #coronavirus bill & expect @potus to sign ASAP

Already been working with @USTreasury & @SBAgov on suggestions for implementing regulations 

For over 60 million small businesses,non-profits & “gig economy” workers this will provide a crucial lifeline

Does the President really not know how the Defense Production Act works, or is he still taking direction from his industry buddies at the @USChamber? https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-26/trump-shuns-war-powers-to-ramp-up-virus-supplies-after-lobbying http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUJFb1cWkAEXpj4.jpg

This kind of nasty partisanship is unhelpful. Everyone understands you don’t like Trump, but now is the time for all of us—Dem and GOP—to come together to defeat this pandemic and restore economic growth. We should all be working for and rooting for America. https://twitter.com/hillaryclinton/status/1243597001754894337 QT @HillaryClinton He did promise "America First." https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/26/health/usa-coronavirus-cases.html
RT @dmedin11 @AOC excoriates Senate bill right now on House floor: "What did the senate majority fight for? One of the largest corporate bailouts...in American history. Shameful."

Thankful for the leadership of our great governor during this challenging time for our state. @GovMurphy is absolutely right. We will get through this together. #JerseyStrong https://twitter.com/GovMurphy/status/1243629450325000196 QT @GovMurphy New Jersey is the most extraordinary state because we’re the most diverse state in America and we are as together as any other state in America as one family.

We will get through this.
@SRuhle It was my pleasure, and tell Louise I hope she takes good care.

Any failure of Instacart to keep its workers safe from the spread of #COVID19 doesn't just put their employees at risk—it puts the entire country at risk. I stand with @Instacart workers in their strike for stronger worker protections. https://twitter.com/TVietor08/status/1243580207342051328 QT @TVietor08 Instacart shoppers are asking for:
-$5 an order hazard pay
-free safety gear (hand sanitizer, soap) 
-paid sick leave expansion to include workers with pre-existing conditions advised by their doctors not to work

Come on @Instacart that is bare minimum! https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/4agmvd/instacarts-gig-workers-are-planning-a-massive-nationwide-strike

Our hospitals are getting overwhelmed. Our medical workers can't get basic protective gear.
 
@realDonaldTrump: It is immoral to delay any longer. Enforce the Defense Production Act to immediately produce and distribute the masks, gloves, gowns, and ventilators we need. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1243591636589953024/img/Wy1LtINTAo8x6YBo.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1243591636589953024/vid/320x320/3KrmNcF_z4g5CVIH.mp4?tag=13

In a rational society, an extremely contagious, deadly virus would get our government to finally pass universal paid sick leave for workers.

Why hasn’t it happened yet? The power of big money over our politics. https://twitter.com/ajfaultlines/status/1241458307144941568 QT @AJFaultLines About 33 million US workers have no paid sick leave. And the US is one of the only countries with no paid maternity leave.

The lack of paid leave has consequences for millions. We asked some of them to share their stories.

Watch 'The Impossible Choice': https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uYRR4oPGng0&feature=youtu.be http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1241383520796315654/img/s5w-r5-2GOAUpFod.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1241383520796315654/vid/320x320/t-OWEPOBAvVvzbMI.mp4?tag=13

This is a $2 trillion bill (~ 10% of our national debt), which is not something that would pass in any ordinary circumstance.
 
But these are extraordinary circumstances.
 
The magnitude of the health & economic threats we face is massive – and requires an extraordinary response. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1243538323685203971/img/NUI2PoKuCpyliFTg.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1243538323685203971/vid/480x270/EnnyrVE5deMMt4Sx.mp4?tag=13
The fact that we are the only major country not to guarantee paid leave, and millions of workers cannot take paid sick days, is a public health emergency.

The federal government must immediately put together the necessary staffing and technology to address the unprecedented number of requests for help that are coming in.

This is a crisis. No business as usual. People need help NOW, not in several months.

I applaud the House for coming together to pass our #COVID19 relief package. Congress and the Administration must continue working together to support or medical personnel on the frontlines, stabilize our economy, and provide relief to workers, families, and businesses.
